name: easel
usage:
easel -h                : show overall brief help summary
easel --version         : show version number
easel <cmd> -h          : show brief help for an Easel command
easel <cmd> [<args>...] : run an Easel command

subcommands.name: alistat
subcommands.description: summary statistics for a multiple seq alignment file

options.description: show brief help on version and usage
use tabular output, one line per alignment
use DNA alphabet (don't autodetect)
use RNA alphabet (don't autodetect)
use protein alphabet (don't autodetect)

subcommands.name: downsample
subcommands.description: downsample <m> things from larger <infile> of n things

options.description: show brief help on version and usage
sequence sampling: <infile> is file or stream of seqs
big sequence sample: <infile> is (seekable) seq file
set random number generator seed [0]

subcommands.name: filter
subcommands.description: remove seqs >= <maxid> fractional identity from MSA

options.description: show brief help on version and usage
send filtered output MSAs to file <f>, not stdout
specify the input MSA file is in format <s>
write the filtered output MSA in format <s>
specify that input MSA is DNA (don't autodetect)
... that input MSA is RNA
... that input MSA is protein
ignore any RF line; always determine our own consensus
seq is fragment if aspan/alen < fragthresh [0.5]
col is consensus if nres/(nres+ngap) >= symfrac [0.5]
never use subsampling to determine consensus
number of seqs to sample (if using sampling) [10000]
switch to using sampling when nseq > nsamp [50000]
if sample has > maxfrag fragments, don't use sample [5000]
set random number seed to <n> [42]
keep seq whose alispan has better consensus coverage [default]
... or with random preference
... or prefer seq that comes first in order

subcommands.name: index
subcommands.description: create SSI fast lookup index for sequence/alignment file

options.description: show brief help on version and usage
index accessions too, if present
parse UniProt db|acc|id names; index id too (and acc, w/ -a)
specify that input file is in format <s>
